sentences: .. ja jooja hiiglakõrisõlm tegi neelates: lõks, lõks.
context: The Estonian word 'lõks' has multiple meanings. It can refer to a physical trap or snare used for catching animals (like mice), or it can be an onomatopoeic sound like a click or latch closing. As an interjection, it represents the clicking sound itself. The word appears to have sound-symbolic origins related to the noise a trap might make when it springs shut.
